intro: Shirakia indica, commonly known as the Indian whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface. The flowers bloom in clusters and are often used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
